Articles.Content:
Either a change to the existing "Subscriptions" mechanism, or a variation thereof:

The current system shows recent activity in subscribed threads, so a list of subscribed threads contains many hundreds of entries.

As a consequence it is hard to find specific threads especially those with little activity, as those are pushed many pages down the list.

I have tried to use it once or twice to find specific threads that i know i have subscribed to, and have since given up.

It would a lot be easier to find threads that one is subscribed to if it would present a list of only the titles of the subscribed threads, and not include recent activity in those threads.

Another thing: i have made a custom subscriptions folder, i can put subscriptions in there but i see no way to view the list of subscriptions in that folder.

Not sure which pages your using for subs, but vBulletin doesn't make this particularly intuitive.

Your UserCP displays the default subscribed threads list, but only those threads with new replies. If the board uses cookies rather than server caching, that list can deplete quite quickly.

Your full subscriptions list can be found under the "Quick Links" drop down in the navbar at the top of the page.

Any customised subscription folders will be under:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/subscription.php?folderid=1

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/subscription.php?folderid=2

etc

respectively.
A belated thank you for the explanation.
